alert.note: Alert for Erie; Huron (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 06 at 6:22PM EDT by NWS Cleveland
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Huron and Erie Counties through 700 PM EDT... At 621 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Wakeman, or near Norwalk, moving east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. Very heavy rain is also falling. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Norwalk, Northern Milan, Milan, Wakeman, Berlin Heights and Birmingham. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
